Description: Blue glazed composition (faience) drinking-cup, in the form of a stemmed lotus flower. The floral motif, with petals of various sizes, is outlined in black (probably manganese) on the exterior of the vessel.
Curator's comments: On faience vessels, including bowls and small drinking vessels, see Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 140-51, especially pp.145-6. The lotus motif, and indeed the qualities of faience as a material, were closely linked to rebirth.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2007-2008 Sep-Apr, Reading Museum, Ancient Egypt
